subject: Invitation to Westeros
event:
Here's the latest treat from the good folks at HBO.

This one is called "Invitation to Westeros."


<lj-embed id="130"/>

comments.article:
[when asked if any of the cast of his book series, "A Song of Ice and Fire", will be left alive]: "No one will be alive by the last book. In fact, they all die in the fifth. The sixth book will be just a thousand-page description of snow blowing across the graves ..."

I just lost all excitement for the series and really don't care if or when the 5th book comes out. Moving on!
comments.subject: The Song of Fire and Ice Series

comments.article: Really? That's what you post? Negativity? Nice.
comments.subject: Re: The Song of Fire and Ice Series
Re: The Song of Fire and Ice Series

comments.article:
...not really sure what THAT'S supposed to mean.

I wanted to exclaim how much more excitement I have for the series, particularly after watching this preview. I'm about halfway through Feast and absolutely hope HBO greenlights more seasons.

Absolutely stunning work. Keep up the good work.
Only two more months!!!  :)
Very excited to see the premiere!
Not seeing the video :(
I don't see it either, but I googled it and watched it on youtube.
That's the first scene I've seen of Tyrion acting. I love Peter Dinklage! (and his character is one of my favorites, too)

Lovely stuff! Particularly liked the gate which the rangers are looking through apprehensively as they get ready to go out -- nice touch. I half-expected them to share the shot of the Wall from the 15-minute reel, but I guess they're holding out on that one.

Right now, the things I most want to see are how Winterfell and the Eyrie look like from a distance, I think.
I can't wait!
This trailer is awesome. Makes me wish I could afford HBO. But I gotta say, the minute it's out on DVD? SO buying it!
Oh, just get HBO...come over to the dark side!:D
comments.subject: HBO vs. A $70 DVD boxed set and a year long wait...
Re: HBO vs. A $70 DVD boxed set and a year long wait...
Re: HBO vs. A $70 DVD boxed set and a year long wait...
Re: HBO vs. A $70 DVD boxed set and a year long wait...
Re: HBO vs. A $70 DVD boxed set and a year long wait...

comments.article: Wow, I am so impressed! I may have to get HBO after all.
This was sweet.  I love that we finally got to see Mormont.
comments.subject: Sweet

comments.article:
Ya, gotta breakdown and do it...haven't had cable since 1993, and the intertubes have lately done a very good job of bringing me anything I felt I was missing.
But THIS!
And, maybe time to step up from a 32" to a 42" LCD as well.
Geez, what a recession buster this show will be!
comments.subject: breakdown

comments.article:
Every new trailer makes me more excited to see this. I can't remember seeing Jon Snow before, but I love what they've done!
I also enjoyed seeing you speak...I don't often see videos of you speaking about your work :)

I did this the whole time I watched:

Okay, I did it quietly so as not to miss out on what anyone was saying. But that is a 100% accurate representation.
Seconded.
My favorite trailer so far! It delivered a strong sense of place which is the clip's stated purpose. Westeros is real!

It looks absolutely tremendous. The acting looks top-notch, and the production values are obviously off the charts. I think this is going to be the series we have been waiting for to slake our thirsts since ROME went off the air.

I only hope it doesn't suffer ROME's tragic fate. Cramming three seasons' worth of story into five episodes. Yuck.
Wow. Anyone having an HBO GoT premiere party in Michigan?!?!? :)
comments.subject: Wow

comments.article: Soooooo excited!  Too bad I can't get HBO to see it at the same time as everyone else... hopefully the DVDs come out quickly!!
I can't wait for April 17th!  BTW, congrats on your recent wedding!

I so wish we were able to subscribe to HBO here in Belgium, but alas...we can't so far. Still, I do hope that the series will come to Europe shortly after it's US release.

And dear Ser Martin, I wanted to thank you from the bottom of my heart, for the best story ever told!!
comments.subject: Excited in Brussels

comments.article: Wildcards?
comments.subject: Re: Excited in Brussels

comments.article: That gave me chills. Already put in my request to have that day off, I'm throwing a party!
comments.subject: Wow

comments.article: This series is gonna be great! By now, I don't mind if it will hit a second or third season (well, i'm praying for it actually), or if conquers the audience or not... the actors are awesome, the photography looks wonderful, and we know that the story is a great one. The scene with Ned and Arya in the way to KL ("the lone wolf dies..." is amongnst my favourites! When i saw Sean and Arya playing it, i found it very moving. And, i had to say, Emilia Rules!

What's frustrating is the chokehold the telecom industries have on premium cable channels like HBO and Showtime. Other than streaming illegally, you cannot get HBO outside a monthly cable subscription. Starz is the only one that streams through Netflix, and mark my words, this network's star is only going to rise. I think HBO and Showtime know this but they're stuck with their cable contracts.

Just think how much money they're leaving on the table by not offering an HBO only plan for live streaming to your monitor or TV.

Yep, it just seems inevitable to me that as more and more content becomes immediately available online, cable just becomes a delivery option and not a sole source for content.

HBO would make so much more it would seem to me, if you could direct subscribe or pay per view the content you actually wanted...
comments.subject: streaming

comments.article: This video gave me the most hope yet that this series will deliver something worthy of your writing, George.  Counting down the days...
Loved it! So excited! :D
